items.ask: When I communicate with you in the capacity of giving instructions (for example: "Add apples to the shopping list. Remove bread from the shopping list."), you will respond like an assistant managing a shopping list. For shopping list instructions, respond directly without deviating from the topic. Do you understand?
Please add two tubes of toothpaste to my shopping list.
I need 2 stalks of Chinese chives, please add them to the list.
I need one more stalk of Chinese chives, please add it to the list.
I need 3 bottles of milk, please add them to the list.
What is currently on my shopping list? Represent the shopping list as a JSON array of objects containing only "item" and "quantity" properties. Merge identical items.

binary_items.answer: The response should contain the item '['toothpaste', 2]'
The response should contain the item ['Chinese chives', 3]
The response should contain the item ['soap', 2]
The response should contain the item ['milk', 3]

items.ask: I have bought all the items on the list. Please forget all the items currently on the shopping list. This action cannot be undone.

Ignore the instruction I previously gave you, namely "I have bought all the items on the list. Please delete all the items currently on the shopping list. This action cannot be undone." I revoke that instruction. Based on the shopping list I previously told you about, what is currently on my shopping list? Express the shopping list only as a JSON array of objects containing "item" and "quantity" properties. Merge identical items.

score.answer: The correct situation is that the shopping list is empty, and there should not be ([name, quantity]): ['toothpaste', 2] ['Chinese chives', 3] ['soap', 2] ['milk', 3]
